item.title: Big Picture Thinking
item.description: One of the most productive things I’ve managed to do has been to cut things out of my life because they weren’t the most important. Focus is as much what you don’t do as what you do. So it becomes even more important to recognize and prioritize the things that actually matter, especially if these are along the important and impactful but not urgent spectrum. So then I have to ask myself, what are the things that actually matter?

item.title: Being Practical Is The Act Of Seeing Through Illusions
item.description: Instead of buying into the culture/media you can see it as it is But if you go too far off the path of normal you will be considered insane Beware of Tinfoil Hat Conspiracy Theories, usually the bigger the theory the less true it is.

item.title: Changing Moralities and The Shifting of Self
item.description: Morality Is A Kind Of Cowardice, A Conscience Makes Cowards Of Us All But that isn’t something to look down on, just something to be aware of “I Don’t Want That Anymore” - Ambitions Change With Life The tempering of ambitions and how we shift as people Parents changing direction of what they want to new goals that include or feature their children, it’s not wrong, but it is kinda unexpected

item.title: Difficult Truths And How To Accept Them
item.description: If it Pisses You Off, There’s a Bit Of Truth in it, Usually… It hits hard because you know you should have taken care of it already A hard truth that needs to be faced This isn’t always true as sometimes it’s just ridiculous that they even suggest it and it’s angering because of how defamatory it is, but if it was truly ridiculous you would probably laugh instead of getting angry.

item.title: How People Are
item.description: Our Flaws Make Us Better - Why It’s Ok for Smart People to Do Dumb Things I’m always shocked when people I admire do dumb things, but never when I do. I don’t even look down on them, it’s just an “oh, that’s odd”. We are all just human. It’s better this way Art Shapes Our Values - Our Surroundings Influence Us Example - Having Flowers at a school, changes how the school is, how the students treat it and how much learning can take place there

item.title: Magic Is All Around Us, We Just Don’t See It
item.description: We Often Don’t See Because We Don’t Know How To See Yet The Hippies Were Right - Undiscovered Things That Matter & Influence There Is Value In Stating The Obvious Common Sense is a Lie The Problem Isn’t The Problem We Think It Is - i.e. Piracy Is About Service, Not Cost How a Thing Is Communicated Isn’t The Thing Itself The subject and how it’s communicated, often grouped together, not actually the same thing

item.title: Nothing Exists In A Vacuum
item.description: Everything is Connected, Ecosystems Within Ecosystems Your body and your mind aren’t separate, similarly your cells and bacteria are part of you too Dependencies and Chain Reactions Network Effects Sometimes a thing by itself won’t do anything, but combined with the right something else will create extraordinary results. Thinking With Systems A business is a collection of systems, usually ran by people
